</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_DK77201_ITEM_7__MANAGEMENT_S_DISCUSSIO__ITE03668">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DK77201_4">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM 7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	The following discussion and analysis of our financial condition and results of operations should be read in
	conjunction with our consolidated financial statements and related notes appearing elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K. The following discussion contains "forward-looking statements"
	that are based on management's current expectations, estimates and projections about our business and operations, and involves risks and uncertainties. Our actual results may differ materially from
	those currently anticipated and expressed in such forward-looking statements as a result of a number of factors, including those we discuss under "Risk Factors," "Cautionary Note Regarding
	Forward-Looking Statements" and elsewhere in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are an independent exploration and production company focused on the application of modern drilling and completion techniques to
	oil-prone resources in the United States. Our operations are primarily focused on exploration and production activities in the Mississippian Lime and Anadarko Basin.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior
	to October&nbsp;1, 2012, all of our growth had been driven through the development of our leasehold acreage located in Louisiana. We initiated operations in 1993 in our North
	Cowards Gully project area and slowly aggregated leasehold acreage in that project area and others over the next eighteen years. In August 2008, First Reserve acquired a majority interest in us and,
	along with members of our senior management, provided a significant amount of growth capital to expand our exploration and development program in Louisiana.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	October 2012, the Company closed on the acquisition of all of Eagle Energy Production,&nbsp;LLC's producing properties and undeveloped acreage, located primarily in the
	Mississippian Lime liquids play in Oklahoma. In May 2013, the Company completed an acquisition of producing properties and undeveloped acreage in the Anadarko Basin in Texas and Oklahoma from Panther
	Energy Company. In
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	58
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=58,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=560539,FOLIO='58',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DK77201A.;24',USER='FSTREET',CD='29-MAR-2016;20:46' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK77201_1_59">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	May
	2014, the Company closed on the divestiture of all of its ownership interest in developed and undeveloped acreage in the Pine Prairie field area of Evangeline Parish, Louisiana. Then, in April
	2015, the Company completed the divestiture of its remaining producing properties in Louisiana with the Dequincy Divestiture. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company has no proved reserves or
	production in the Gulf Coast operating area.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	current activities are focused on evaluating and developing our asset base, optimizing our acreage position, and identifying potential expansion areas across our Mississippian and
	Anadarko Basin operating areas. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, since the third quarter of 2008 we had spud approximately 461 gross wells (including 248 in our Mississippian operating area since the
	fourth quarter of 2012 and 69 in our Anadarko operating area since the second quarter of 2013).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our properties consisted of approximately 204,791 net acre leasehold, with 749 gross active producing wells, 65% of which we operate, and in which we held
	an average working interest of approximately 69%. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, our estimated net proved reserves were 73.5 MMBoe, of which 56% was oil or NGLs and 94% was proved developed. During
	the three months and year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, our properties had aggregate average net daily production of approximately 30,890 Boe/d and 32,880 Boe/d, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Recent Developments
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Debt Restructuring and Credit Facility.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On May&nbsp;21, 2015, we completed a debt restructuring transaction which included the
	issuance of
	$625.0&nbsp;million of 10.0% Senior Secured Second Lien Notes due 2020 and utilized the proceeds to repay the outstanding balance of our Credit Facility in an amount of approximately
	$468.2&nbsp;million, with the remainder available for general corporate purposes. Further, we
	exchanged approximately $504.1&nbsp;million of 12.0% Third Lien Senior Secured Notes due 2020 for approximately $279.8&nbsp;million of 10.75% Senior Notes due 2020 and $350.3&nbsp;million of
	9.25% Senior Notes due 2021, representing an exchange at 80.0% of the exchanged Unsecured Notes' par value. Additionally, on June&nbsp;2, 2015, we exchanged approximately $20.0&nbsp;million of
	Third Lien Notes for approximately $26.6&nbsp;million of 2020 Senior Notes and $2.0&nbsp;million of 2021 Senior Notes, representing an exchange at 70.0% of the exchanged Unsecured Notes' par
	value. Approximately $63.9&nbsp;million of the principal amount of 2020 Senior Notes and $70.7&nbsp;million of the principal amount of 2021 Senior Notes were extinguished as a result of the
	exchanges occurring at a percentage below the Unsecured Notes' par value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally,
	we entered into the Seventh Amendment to the Credit Facility (the "Seventh Amendment") which provided that upon completion of the offering of the Second Lien Notes and
	Third Lien Notes, the borrowing base of the Credit Facility would be reduced to $252.0&nbsp;million. The Seventh Amendment also provided additional covenant flexibility. Further discussion regarding
	the Second Lien Notes, Third Lien Notes and Seventh Amendment can be found below under "&#151;Liquidity and Ability to Continue as a Going Concern."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	October&nbsp;14, 2015, we entered into the Ninth Amendment to the Credit Facility which, among other things, reaffirmed the borrowing base at $252.0&nbsp;million and provided
	flexibility for certain specified asset sales by confirming the amount of the reduction in the borrowing base if any such sale should occur.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Reverse Stock Split.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On August&nbsp;3, 2015, we completed a 1-for-10 reverse stock split of our outstanding common stock. To
	effect the reverse
	stock split, we filed a Certificate of Amendment to our Restated Certificate of Incorporation, which provides for the reverse stock split and for the corresponding reduction in our authorized capital
	stock to 100&nbsp;million shares of common stock, $0.01 par value per share, following the reverse stock split.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On October&nbsp;1, 2012, we issued 325,000 shares of Series&nbsp;A Mandatorily Convertible
	Preferred Stock
	("Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock") with an initial liquidation preference of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	59
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=59,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=114959,FOLIO='59',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DK77201A.;24',USER='FSTREET',CD='29-MAR-2016;20:46' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK77201_1_60">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$1,000
	per share and an 8.0% per annum dividend, payable semiannually at the Company's option in cash or through an increase in the liquidation preference. On September&nbsp;30, 2015, all 325,000
	shares of the Series&nbsp;A Preferred Stock converted into shares of our common stock at a conversion price of $110.00 per share, which was automatically adjusted to reflect the reverse stock split.
	Each Series&nbsp;A
	Preferred Share converted into approximately 11.5 shares of our common stock, and as a result, we issued 3,738,424 additional shares of our common stock upon conversion of the Series&nbsp;A
	Preferred Stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Delistment.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On February&nbsp;3, 2016, we received notice from the NYSE that the Company's common stock no longer met the NYSE
	continued listing
	requirements. As a result, the Company's common stock was automatically delisted from the NYSE and began trading on the OTC Pink marketplace, an over the counter exchange, under the symbol "MPOY".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of the sustained commodity price decline and our substantial debt burden, we believe that forecasted cash and available
	credit capacity will not be sufficient to meet commitments as they come due over the next twelve months, and we will not be able to remain in compliance with current debt covenants unless we are able
	to successfully increase liquidity or deleverage. The uncertainty associated with the ability to meet commitments as they come due or to repay outstanding debt raises substantial doubt about our
	ability to continue as a going concern. In consideration of the uncertainty mentioned above, the report of our independent registered public accounting firm that accompanies our audited consolidated
	financial statements for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K contains an explanatory paragraph regarding an event of default under the Credit Facility, a
	projected additional debt covenant violation, and resulting lack of liquidity, which raises substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a going concern.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	report of our independent registered public accounting firm that accompanied our consolidated financial statements for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 also contained an
	explanatory paragraph regarding a projected debt covenant violation and resulting lack of liquidity raising substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a going concern; however, we obtained a
	waiver to the Credit Facility waiving any default as a result of receiving such explanatory paragraph in 2014. We have not received a similar waiver from our lenders under the Credit Facility for the
	explanatory paragraph to our 2015 independent registered public accounting firm report. As a result, we are in default under our Credit Facility. A failure to cure this default within 30 days will
	result in the acceleration of all of our indebtedness under the Credit Facility. If the lenders under our Credit Facility accelerate the loans outstanding thereunder, we will also be in default under
	the indentures governing our Senior Notes, in which case the lenders under the indentures governing our Senior Notes could accelerate the repayment thereof.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	lenders, and subsequently noteholders, accelerate the Company's outstanding indebtedness, it will become immediately due and payable and the Company will not have sufficient liquidity
	to repay those amounts. If we are unable to reach an agreement with our creditors prior to any of the above described
	accelerations, we could be required to immediately file for protection under Chapter&nbsp;11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	60
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=60,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=65319,FOLIO='60',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DK77201A.;24',USER='FSTREET',CD='29-MAR-2016;20:46' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK77201_1_61">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Risks and Uncertainties
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our decisions on capital structure, hedging and drilling are based upon widely available information of anticipated future commodity
	pricing and expected economic conditions. The unexpected substantial decrease in oil and gas prices that began in the second half of 2014 and continued throughout 2015 and into 2016 has resulted in
	materially lower operating cash flows than expected. Our hedging contracts helped to mitigate the impact of lower commodity prices during 2015 and we received cash settlements of these derivatives of
	$167.7&nbsp;million, which comprised 78.6% of our cash provided by operations during 2015. However, all of our hedging contracts expired during 2015, and as a result, we will not receive any cash
	derivative settlements for 2016 or future periods as compared to our historical operating cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	February 2016, we borrowed approximately $249.2&nbsp;million under our Credit Facility, which represented the remaining undrawn amount that was available under the Credit Facility
	and as a result, as of February&nbsp;9, 2016, we had a cash balance of approximately $335.7&nbsp;million. Our borrowing base under our Credit Facility will be redetermined in April 2016. Any
	reduction in the borrowing base of the Credit Facility will result in a deficiency which must be repaid within 30&nbsp;days or in six equal monthly installments thereafter, at our election. We may
	not have the financial resources to make any mandatory deficiency principal repayments, which could result in an event of default under the Credit Facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have substantial interest payment obligations over the next twelve months related to our debt. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, payments due on contractual obligations during the next
	twelve months were approximately $188.0&nbsp;million. This includes approximately $179.5&nbsp;million of interest payments on our Senior Notes and other operating expenses such as fixed drilling
	commitments and operating leases. The Company's next scheduled interest payment is April&nbsp;1, 2016 for $15.8&nbsp;million to the holders of the 2020 Senior Notes and the Company is currently
	evaluating whether such interest payment will be made. If the payment is not made by April&nbsp;1, 2016, we would have 30&nbsp;days to cure such payment default before an event of default occurs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	a result of the sustained commodity price decline and our substantial debt burden, we believe that forecasted cash and available credit capacity will not be sufficient to meet our
	commitments as they come due over the next twelve months, and we will not be able to remain in compliance with current debt covenants unless we are able to successfully increase liquidity or
	deleverage. The uncertainty associated with the ability to meet commitments as they come due or to repay outstanding debt raises substantial doubt about our ability to continue as a going concern. The
	accompanying financial statements do not include any adjustments related to the recoverability and classification of recorded assets or the amounts and classification of liabilities that might result
	from the uncertainty associated with the ability to meet obligations as they come due.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	order to increase our liquidity to levels sufficient to meet our commitments, we are currently undertaking a number of actions, including minimizing capital expenditures, aggressively
	managing working capital and further reducing our recurring operating expenses. We believe that even after taking these actions, we will not have sufficient liquidity to satisfy our debt service
	obligations, meet other financial obligations, and comply with our debt covenants. We have engaged financial and legal advisors to assist with analyzing various strategic alternatives to address our
	liquidity and capital structure, among other things. We believe a filing under Chapter&nbsp;11 of the U.S. Bankruptcy Code may provide the most expeditious manner in which to effect a capital
	structure solution. There can be no assurance we will be able to restructure our capital structure on terms acceptable to us, our creditors, or at all.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	61
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM77201_1_62">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Our Revenue
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Oil, NGLs and natural gas.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our revenues are derived from the sale of oil and natural gas production, as well as the sale of NGLs that
	are extracted
	from our high Btu content natural gas. Our oil and gas revenues do not include the effects of derivatives, and may vary significantly from period to period as a result of changes in production volumes
	or commodity prices. A continued decline in commodity prices could materially and adversely affect our business, financial condition and results of operations. Prices for oil, NGLs and natural gas
	fluctuate widely and affect:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the amount of our cash flows available for capital expenditures;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our ability to borrow and raise additional capital;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the quantity of oil, NGLs and natural gas we can economically produce; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	revenues and profitability.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Average
	market prices for oil and NGLs decreased significantly in the last part of 2014 with continued declines through 2015. If commodity prices remain depressed as compared to
	historical levels, we expect significantly lower revenues and operating cash flows compared to historical results. For a description of factors that may impact future commodity prices, please read
	"Risk Factors&#151;Risks Related to the Oil and Natural Gas Industry and our Business."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Realized and unrealized gain (loss) on commodity derivative financial contracts.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We, at times, utilize commodity derivatives to reduce
	our exposure
	to fluctuations in the prices of oil, NGLs and natural gas. Accordingly, our income statements reflect (i)&nbsp;the recognition of unrealized gains and losses associated with our open derivative
	contracts as commodity prices change and commodity derivatives contracts expire or new ones are entered into, and (ii)&nbsp;our realized gains or losses on the settlement of these commodity
	derivative contracts. Unrealized gains and losses result from changes in market valuations of derivatives as future commodity price expectations change compared to the contract prices on the
	derivatives. If the expected future commodity prices increase compared to the contract prices on the derivatives, unrealized losses are recognized. Conversely, if the expected future commodity prices
	decrease compared to the contract prices on the derivatives, unrealized gains are recognized. Since we have elected not to apply hedge accounting to our derivatives, we reflect the unrealized and
	realized gains and losses in our current income statement periods based on the mark-to-market value at the end of each month. Cash flows associated with derivative financial instruments are reflected
	in cash flow from operations in our consolidated statement of cash flows. We had no open derivative contracts at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and currently have no open derivative contracts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Our Expenses
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lease operating and workover expenses.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lease operating expenses represent costs incurred to bring oil and gas out of the ground and to
	the market,
	together with the daily costs incurred to maintain our producing properties. Such costs also include natural gas treating expenses and the handling and disposal of produced water as well as
	maintenance and repair expenses related to our oil and gas properties. Lease operating expenses include both a portion of costs that are fixed in nature, such as infrastructure costs, as well as
	variable costs resulting from additional wells and production. As production increases, our average lease operating expense per barrel of oil equivalent is typically reduced because fixed costs do not
	increase proportionately with production. Workover expense includes major remedial operations on a completed well to restore, maintain, or improve a well's production and is closely correlated to the
	levels of workover activity. Because workover projects are pursued on an as needed basis and are not regularly scheduled, workover expense is not necessarily comparable from period to period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	62
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=62,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=442953,FOLIO='62',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DM77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:57' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM77201_1_63">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gathering and transportation.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;These costs are incurred for the gathering and transportation of natural gas to the contractual delivery
	point. For
	2015 and 2014, these costs primarily relate to the amended gas transportation, gathering and processing contract which commenced during the third quarter of 2013 in our Mississippian Lime area of
	operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severance and other taxes.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severance taxes are paid on produced oil and gas based on a percentage of revenues from products sold at
	market prices or
	at fixed rates established by federal, state, or local taxing authorities. We attempt to take full advantage of all credits and exemptions in our various taxing jurisdictions. In general, the
	severance taxes we pay correlate to the changes in oil and gas revenues. Ad valorem taxes are property taxes assessed based on the value of property and are also included in this expense category.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation, depletion and amortization.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the full cost accounting method, we capitalize costs within a cost center and
	systematically expense
	those costs on a unit of production basis based on proved oil and natural gas reserve quantities. We calculate depletion on the following types of costs: (i)&nbsp;all capitalized costs, other than
	the cost of investments in unproved properties which remain to be evaluated, less accumulated amortization; (ii)&nbsp;estimated future expenditures to be incurred in developing proved reserves; and
	(iii)&nbsp;estimated dismantlement and abandonment costs, net of any associated salvage value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Impairment in carrying value of oil and gas properties.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As a public company, we apply Rule&nbsp;4-10 of Regulation&nbsp;S-X, which
	requires the
	full-cost ceiling test to be performed on a quarterly basis. The test establishes a limit (ceiling) on the book value of oil and gas properties. The capitalized costs of proved oil and gas properties,
	net of accumulated depreciation, depletion and amortization ("DD&amp;A") and the related deferred income taxes, may not exceed this "ceiling." The ceiling limitation is equal to the sum of: (i)&nbsp;the
	present value of estimated future net revenues from the projected production of proved oil and gas reserves, excluding future cash outflows associated with settling asset retirement obligations
	accrued on the balance sheet, calculated using the average oil and natural gas sales price we received as of the first trading day of each month over the preceding twelve months (such average price is
	held constant throughout the life of the properties) and a discount factor of 10%; (ii)&nbsp;the cost of unproved and unevaluated properties excluded from the costs being amortized; (iii)&nbsp;the
	lower of cost or estimated fair value of unproved properties included in the costs being amortized; and (iv)&nbsp;related income tax effects. If capitalized costs exceed this ceiling, the excess is
	charged to impairment expense in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative expense consists, among other items, of overhead, including payroll and
	benefits for
	our corporate staff, non-cash charges for share-based compensation, costs of maintaining our headquarters, franchise taxes, audit and other professional fees, legal compliance, reporting expenses,
	investor relations, director and officer liability insurance costs, and director compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Acquisition and transaction costs.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Anadarko Basin Acquisition qualified as the acquisition of a business under Accounting Standards
	Codification
	("ASC") Topic 805,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Business Combinations
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. Acquisition and transaction costs are costs we have has incurred as a result of acquisitions or as a result of
	asset disposal transactions such as the Pine Prairie Disposition and Dequincy Divestiture, and include finders' fees; advisory, legal, accounting, valuation and other professional and consulting fees;
	and acquisition or disposition related general and administrative costs. ASC 805 requires acquisition related costs to be expensed as incurred and as services are received.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Debt restructuring costs.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the second quarter of 2015, we completed a series of transactions to restructure a portion of our long-term
	debt. We
	incurred various costs related to these transactions, including advisory fees, legal fees and financing expenses, which are separately identified in the statement of operations for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	63
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=63,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=1017088,FOLIO='63',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DM77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:57' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM77201_1_64">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other expense consists of, among other things, losses on disposal of, or market value adjustments to, field equipment
	inventory,
	penalties on early termination of drilling contracts and other miscellaneous expense items.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest expense.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have substantial long-term debt in the form of our Senior Notes. Additionally, we finance a portion of our working
	capital
	requirements and capital expenditures with borrowings under our Credit Facility. As a result, we incur interest expense, a portion of which is affected by both fluctuations in interest rates and our
	financing decisions. We reflect interest paid to our note holders and the lenders under our Credit Facility in interest expense, as well as the amortization of the related deferred financing costs,
	net of any amounts capitalized to unproved properties. Amortization of the deferred gain recognized on the restructuring of our debt, which occurred in the second quarter of 2015, is recognized using
	the effective interest method as a reduction to interest expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Results of Operations
</U>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following tables summarize our revenues, production and price data for the periods indicated. Periods prior to April&nbsp;21,
	2015 include production, revenue and lease operating expenses related to the Dequincy properties, the sale of which closed on April&nbsp;21, 2015. Prior to May&nbsp;1, 2014, our operating results
	include production, revenue and lease operating expenses attributable to the Pine Prairie field assets, the sale of which closed effective May&nbsp;1, 2014. Where applicable, in the following
	discussion, we have noted normalized production, revenue, lease operating expenses and percentages for prior periods as though the Pine Prairie Disposition occurred as of the beginning of that period.
	Additionally, the 2013 period includes only seven months of results from our Anadarko Basin area due to the timing of the Anadarko Basin Acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>

<TR BGCOLOR="WHITE" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:20PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Natural gas sales
</FONT>
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Oil, Natural Gas Liquids and Natural Gas Revenues.
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our oil sales revenues decreased by $249.1&nbsp;million, or 53%, to $217.6&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015 as compared to $466.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Lower revenue was primarily the result of decreases in oil prices for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as
	compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Oil volumes sold decreased 350 MBbls or 7% to 4,794&nbsp;MBbls for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 from 5,144 MBbls for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. The decrease in oil volumes sold was due to a decrease of 84%, or 514 MBbls, of production volumes in the Gulf Coast due to the sale of our remaining producing properties in
	Louisiana in April of 2015, as well as a decrease of 33%, or 487 MBbls in production volumes from our Anadarko Basin area attributable to natural production declines as we ran no drilling rigs during
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 due to the decline in commodity prices. These decreases were partially offset by an increase in Mississippian Lime production of 21%, or 651 MBbls. For the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we brought approximately 81 wells online in the Mississippian Lime, which drove the 21% increase in daily production in the Mississippi Lime area. Average oil
	sales prices, without realized derivatives, decreased by $45.31 per barrel, or 50%, to $45.40 per barrel for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to $90.71 for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. Of the $217.6&nbsp;million in total oil sales revenues, $169.2&nbsp;million was from Mississippian Lime operations, $43.7&nbsp;million was from the Anadarko Basin and
	$4.7&nbsp;million was from the Gulf Coast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	NGLs sales revenues decreased by $49.6&nbsp;million, or 56%, to $38.2&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to $87.8&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Lower
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	65
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=65,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=79755,FOLIO='65',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DM77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:57' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM77201_1_66">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	revenue
	was primarily the result of decreases in NGLs prices for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. NGLs volumes sold increased 56 MBbls,
	or 2%, to 2,473 MBbls for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to 2,417 MBbls for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase in NGLs volumes sold was attributable to an
	increase of 317 MBbls of production volumes from our Mississippian Lime area, partially offset by decreases in Anadarko Basin production of 138 MBbls and Gulf Coast production of 123 MBbls. Average
	NGLs prices, without realized derivatives, decreased by $20.85 per barrel, or 57%, to $15.46 per barrel for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to $36.31 per barrel for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. Of the $38.2&nbsp;million in total NGLs revenues, $30.7&nbsp;million was from Mississippian Lime operations, $7.0&nbsp;million was from the Anadarko Basin and
	$0.5&nbsp;million was from the Gulf Coast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	natural gas sales revenues decreased by $32.4&nbsp;million, or 33%, to $66.8&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to $99.2&nbsp;million for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Lower revenue was primarily the result of decreases in natural gas prices for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. Natural gas volumes sold increased 3,390&nbsp;MMcf, or 14%, to 28,403 MMcf for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to 25,013&nbsp;MMcf for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase in natural gas volumes sold was attributable to an increase of 4,622 MMcf of production volumes from our Mississippian Lime area, partially offset by decreases
	of 733 MMcf in production from our Anadarko Basin area and 499 MMcf from our Gulf Coast area. Average natural gas prices, without realized derivatives, decreased by $1.62 per Mcf, or 41%, to $2.35 per
	Mcf for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to $3.97 per Mcf for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Of the $66.8&nbsp;million in total natural gas sales revenues,
	$56.5&nbsp;million was from Mississippian Lime operations, $10.1&nbsp;million was from Anadarko Basin and $0.2&nbsp;million was from the Gulf Coast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our oil sales revenues increased by $79.5&nbsp;million, or 21%, to $466.7&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014 as compared to $387.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Oil volumes sold increased 1,240 MBbls or 32% to 5,144 MBbls for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from
	3,904&nbsp;MBbls for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The increase in oil volumes sold was due to an increase of 1,403 MBbls in production volumes from our Mississippian Lime area
	attributable to continued increased drilling activity in 2014, and 648 MBbls of additional production volumes from our Anadarko Basin area (the 2013 comparative period included only seven months of
	results due to the timing of the Anadarko Basin Acquisition), partially offset by a decrease in Gulf Coast production of 811 MBbls (of which, approximately 632 MBbls was related to the Pine Prairie
	Disposition). For the twelve months ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, we brought approximately gross 120 wells online, which contributed to the 34% increase in daily production. Average oil sales
	prices, without realized derivatives, decreased by $8.47 per barrel, or 9%, to $90.71 per barrel for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $99.18 for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013. Of the $466.7&nbsp;million in total oil sales revenues, $272.9&nbsp;million was from Mississippian Lime operations, $134.0&nbsp;million was from the Anadarko Basin and
	$59.8&nbsp;million was from the Gulf Coast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	NGLs sales revenues increased by $25.5&nbsp;million, or 41%, to $87.8&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $62.3&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. NGLs volumes sold increased 698 MBbls, or 41%, to 2,417 MBbls for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to 1,719 MBbls for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013. The increase in NGLs volumes sold was attributable to an increase of 663 MBbls of production volumes from our Mississippian Lime area and 250 MBbls of additional production
	volumes from our Anadarko Basin area (the 2013 comparative period included only seven months of results due to the timing of the Anadarko Basin Acquisition), partially offset by a decrease in Gulf
	Coast production of 215 MBbls (of which, approximately 137&nbsp;MBbls related to the Pine Prairie Disposition). Average NGLs prices, without realized derivatives,
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	66
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=66,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=1030026,FOLIO='66',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DM77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:57' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM77201_1_67">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	increased
	by $0.05 per barrel, to $36.31 per barrel for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $36.26 per barrel for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Of the
	$87.8&nbsp;million in total NGLs revenues, $57.7&nbsp;million was from Mississippian Lime operations, $23.8&nbsp;million was from the Anadarko Basin and $6.3&nbsp;million was from the Gulf
	Coast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	natural gas sales revenues increased by $36.0&nbsp;million, or 57%, to $99.2&nbsp;million during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $63.2&nbsp;million for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Natural gas volumes sold increased 6,356 MMcf, or 34%, to 25,013 MMcf for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to 18,657 MMcf for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013. The increase in natural gas
	volumes sold was attributable to an increase of 6,293 MMcf of production volumes from our Mississippian Lime area and 1,960 MMcf of additional production volumes from our Anadarko Basin area (the 2013
	comparative period included only seven months of results due to the timing of the Anadarko Basin Acquisition), partially offset by a 1,897 MMcf decrease in production from our Gulf Coast area (of
	which, approximately 1,577 MMcf related to the Pine Prairie Disposition). Average natural gas prices, without realized derivatives, increased by $0.58 per Mcf, or 17%, to $3.97 per Mcf for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $3.39 per Mcf for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Of the $99.2&nbsp;million in total natural gas sales revenues, $75.4&nbsp;million was from
	Mississippian Lime operations, $21.1&nbsp;million was from Anadarko Basin and $2.7&nbsp;million was from the Gulf Coast.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Gains/Losses on Commodity Derivative Contracts&#151;Net.
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our overall derivative gain of $41.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was attributable to realized gains of
	$167.7&nbsp;million, offset by $126.7&nbsp;million related to mark-to-market ("MTM") derivative positions as of December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	realized gain on derivatives for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was $167.7&nbsp;million compared to a realized loss of $18.3&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014. See the following table:
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash
	settlements, as presented in the table above, represent realized gains related to our derivative instruments. In addition to cash settlements, we also recognize fair value changes
	on our derivative instruments in each reporting period. The changes in fair value result from new positions and settlements that may occur during each reporting period, as well as the relationships
	between contract
	prices and the associated forward curves. We currently have no derivative instruments and had none outstanding at December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our overall derivative gain of $139.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was attributable to unrealized gains
	of $157.5&nbsp;million related to MTM derivative positions, offset by $18.3&nbsp;million in realized losses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	67
</FONT>
</P>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash
	settlements, as presented in the table above, represent realized gains related to our derivative instruments. In addition to cash settlements, we also recognize fair value changes
	on our derivative instruments in each reporting period. The changes in fair value result from new positions and settlements that may occur during each reporting period, as well as the relationships
	between contract prices and the associated forward curves.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Lease Operating and Workover.
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lease operating and workover expenses increased $1.9&nbsp;million, or 2%, to $81.5&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to $79.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Lease operating expenses decreased $4.4&nbsp;million, or 6%, to $70.1&nbsp;million for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as compared to $74.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The decrease in lease operating expense is primarily related to the Dequincy
	Divestiture in the second quarter of 2015. Workover expenses increased $6.3&nbsp;million, or 124%, to $11.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, as compared to
	$5.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase in workover expenses during the year is due to increased production optimization projects, primarily in the
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	68
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=68,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=168120,FOLIO='68',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DM77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:57' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM77201_1_69">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Anadarko
	Basin. While the total lease operating and workover expenses increased, the per unit amounts remained unchanged at $6.79 per&nbsp;Boe for both years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lease operating and workover expenses increased $6.2&nbsp;million, or 8%, to $79.6&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to $73.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Lease operating expenses increased $9.2&nbsp;million, or 14%, to $74.5&nbsp;million for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as compared to $65.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This change is almost entirely attributable to the increase in producing well count
	for the Mississippian Lime and Anadarko Basin areas year over year; there were approximately 150 more active wells in 2014 for these areas versus the prior year. Workover expenses decreased
	$3.0&nbsp;million, or 37%, to $5.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, as compared to $8.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The Gulf Coast region
	workover costs decreased approximately $2.2&nbsp;million period over period. While the total lease operating and workover expenses increased, the per unit amounts decreased to $6.79 per Boe for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from $8.41 per Boe for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, a decrease of 19%, driven primarily by the 34% increase in production year over year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Gathering and Transportation.
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gathering and transportation expense increased $2.1&nbsp;million, or 16%, to $15.5&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to $13.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The increase was primarily attributable to the 14% increase in natural gas production volumes for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, which are subject to gathering and transportation fees, including our gas transportation, gathering and processing contract in the Mississippian Lime.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_25"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gathering and transportation expense increased $7.9&nbsp;million, or 144%, to $13.4&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to $5.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. These expenses are primarily attributable to a gas transportation, gathering and processing
	contract which commenced during the third quarter of 2013 in the Mississippian Lime. As such, the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 includes only two quarters of the expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->

</U>
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severance and other taxes decreased $15.7&nbsp;million, or 65%, to $8.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as
	compared to $24.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Severance
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	69
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=69,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=693578,FOLIO='69',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DM77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:57' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM77201_1_70">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	taxes
	decreased $11.9&nbsp;million, or 67%, to $5.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to $17.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and as a
	percentage of sales, decreased from 2.7% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to 1.8% for the corresponding 2015 period. The decrease was primarily due to lower realized pricing in the 2015
	period and the sale of our Louisiana properties which had higher effective severance tax rates than our Mississippian Lime and Anadarko Basin properties. Ad valorem taxes decreased
	$3.7&nbsp;million, or 56%, to $2.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, as compared to $6.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, due to a significant
	decrease in the value of our proved oil and gas reserves.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severance and other taxes decreased $2.9&nbsp;million, or 11%, to $24.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as
	compared to $27.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. Severance taxes decreased $3.6&nbsp;million, or 17%, to $17.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
	compared to $21.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 and as a percentage of sales,
	decreased from 4.2% for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to 2.7% for the corresponding 2014 period. The decrease was primarily due to lower effective severance tax rates in our Mississippian
	Lime and Anadarko Basin areas and lower production period-over-period in the relatively higher tax Gulf Coast region resulting from reduced drilling activity in 2014 and the Pine Prairie Disposition.
	Ad valorem taxes increased $0.7&nbsp;million, or 12%, to $6.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, as compared to $5.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2013, due to higher ad valorem taxes in the Anadarko Basin and Gulf Coast area.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Depreciation, Depletion and Amortization ("DD&amp;A").
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DD&amp;A expense decreased $71.3&nbsp;million, or 26%, to $198.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to
	$269.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The decreased DD&amp;A expense is primarily attributable to lower DD&amp;A rates, $16.55 per Boe for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015
	as compared to $23.01 per Boe for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, primarily due to ceiling test impairments recognized during the 2015 period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DD&amp;A expense increased $19.5&nbsp;million, or 8%, to $269.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to
	$250.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The DD&amp;A rate for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was $23.01 per Boe compared to $28.67 per Boe for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2013. The increase in total DD&amp;A expense for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 was primarily due to higher oil, NGLs and natural gas production attributable to a full year of
	production from the Anadarko Basin Acquisition assets as well as developmental drilling during 2014 in the Mississippian Lime area. The lower DD&amp;A rate per Boe is attributable to the overall growth in
	proved reserves during 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Impairment of Oil and Gas Properties.
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our impairment of oil and gas properties pursuant to the full cost ceiling test was $1.6&nbsp;billion and $86.5&nbsp;million for
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Under the full cost method, we are subject to quarterly calculations of a ceiling or limitation on the amount of capitalized costs
	associated with our oil and natural gas properties in our consolidated balance sheets. The impairment expense for the 2015 period was primarly due to a decrease in the PV-10 value of our proven oil
	and natural gas reserves as a result of continued low commodity prices. Subsequent to
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	70
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=70,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=622410,FOLIO='70',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DM77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:57' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM77201_1_71">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	December&nbsp;31,
	2015, commodity prices have declined further. As a result, the simple average of oil and natural gas prices as of the first day of each month for the trailing 12-months utilized in
	calculating the PV-10 value of our oil and gas properties will continue to decline throughout the first quarter of 2016, which will negatively impact the discounted present value of the Company's
	proved oil and gas reserves and could lead to additional impairments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our impairment of oil and gas properties pursuant to the full cost ceiling test was $83.5&nbsp;million, net of taxes, for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to $319.6&nbsp;million, net of taxes, for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The most significant factors affecting the 2014 impairment, which was
	recorded in the first quarter of 2014, related to the transfer of unevaluated property costs to the full cost pool.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	General and Administrative ("G&amp;A").
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our G&amp;A expenses decreased to $38.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 from $48.7&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The $10.0&nbsp;million decrease period over period is primarily related to a $4.8&nbsp;million reduction in employee costs due to reduced headcount in 2015, a
	$4.4&nbsp;million increase in capitalized overhead costs and cost recoveries, as well as $0.6&nbsp;million less in professional fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our G&amp;A expenses decreased to $48.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 from $53.3&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The $4.6&nbsp;million decrease period over period is primarily related to: $2.0&nbsp;million in additional COPAS recoveries, $11.5&nbsp;million less in transition
	services payments (in 2013 and part of 2014, payments were made as a result of the Eagle Property Acquisition and Anadarko Basin Acquisition) and $3.4&nbsp;million less in other taxes, partially
	offset by an increase of $10.1&nbsp;million in employee costs (including salary, bonus, severance related to the Houston office closure and share-based compensation) and $2.2&nbsp;million of other
	G&amp;A costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Acquisition and Transaction Costs.
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our acquisition and transaction costs decreased by $3.8&nbsp;million to $0.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2015 from $4.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. For the twelve months ending December&nbsp;31, 2015, these costs are related to our expenses incurred with the Dequincy
	Divestiture discussed above. For the comparable period in 2014, these costs generally represent our expenses related to the Pine Prairie Disposition discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our acquisition and transaction costs decreased by $7.7&nbsp;million to $4.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014 from $11.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. For the 2014 period, these costs generally represent our expenses related to the Pine Prairie Disposition discussed above.
	For the 2013 period, these costs represent our expenses related to the Anadarko Basin Acquisition discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	71
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Debt Restructuring Costs and Advisory Fees.
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the 2015 period, we engaged various advisors to assist us in analyzing options to improve our financial flexibility and provide
	additional long-term liquidity. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, we incurred approximately $36.1&nbsp;million in fees associated with these
	advisors as well as issuance costs associated with the Second Lien Notes offering and Third Lien Notes exchange. No such costs were incurred in the comparable 2014 and 2013 periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
<U>
	Other.
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other operating expenses for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 were $2.1&nbsp;million, compared to $5.1&nbsp;million for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. During the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, these expenses relate to the loss on disposal of, or market value adjustments to, field equipment inventory deemed
	no longer useful to current operations. The comparable period in 2014 included these inventory adjustments, as well as penalty fees associated with the early termination of a drilling contract and
	other miscellaneous expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_26"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 as Compared to the Year Ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other operating expenses for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 were $5.1&nbsp;million, compared to $0.6&nbsp;million for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. These expenses represent the loss on disposal of, or market value adjustments to, field equipment inventory deemed no longer useful to current operations, penalty
	fees associated with the early termination of a drilling contract, as well as other miscellaneous expenses.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
