	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Sanchez Energy Corporation
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Stone Energy Corp.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Swift Energy&nbsp;Co.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Longnecker
	compiled compensation data for the peer group from a variety of sources, including proxy statements and other publicly filed documents. Longnecker also provided published
	survey compensation data from multiple sources. This compensation data was then used to compare the compensation of our Named Executive Officers to individuals with comparable duties and
	responsibilities at companies within our peer group and in the survey data.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	subsequent years, our Compensation Committee will review and re-determine on an annual basis the composition of our peer group so that the peer group will continue to consist of
	appropriate peer companies, taking into account the factors previously mentioned.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Role of the Compensation Consultant
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Compensation Committee's charter grants the Committee the sole authority to retain, at our
	expense, outside
	consultants or experts to assist it in its duties. For 2015, our Compensation Committee engaged Longnecker to advise it with respect to executive compensation matters, including development of the
	annual compensation peer group and an annual review and evaluation of our executive and director compensation packages generally, based on, among other things, survey data and information regarding
	general trends. Representatives from Longnecker periodically meet with our Compensation Committee throughout the year and advise our Compensation Committee with regard to general trends in director
	and executive compensation, including (i)&nbsp;competitive benchmarking; (ii)&nbsp;incentive plan design; (iii)&nbsp;peer group selection; and (iv)&nbsp;other matters relating to executive
	compensation. In addition, Longnecker provides our Compensation Committee and management with survey compensation data regarding our compensation peer group for each fiscal year. Longnecker did not
	provide any services to us or to management other than the services provided to the Compensation Committee. As discussed above under "Meetings and Committees of Directors&#151;Compensation
	Committee," the Compensation Committee has concluded that we do not have any conflicts of interest with Longnecker.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Elements of Our Compensation and Why We Pay Each Element
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The compensation program for our Named Executive Officers is comprised of the following five
	elements:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	base salary;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	annual performance-based cash incentive awards;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	long-term equity-based compensation (including restricted stock awards);
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	retention awards; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	other employee benefits.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Base Salary
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Base salary is the fixed annual compensation we pay to each Named Executive Officer for performing specific job
	responsibilities. It
	represents the minimum income a Named Executive Officer may receive in any year. We pay each Named Executive Officer a base salary in order to:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	recognize each executive officer's unique value and contributions to our success in light of salary norms in the industry and the
	general marketplace;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	remain competitive for executive-level talent within our industry;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	provide executives with sufficient, regularly-paid income; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reflect position and level of responsibility.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	100
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=100,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=689807,FOLIO='100',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DU77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:58' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DU77201_1_101">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	setting annual base salary amounts, our Compensation Committee aims to pay base salaries that, by position, are in approximately the 50
<SUP>
	th
</SUP>
	&nbsp;percentile of our peer
	group, although the Compensation Committee also takes into consideration factors such as the particular officer's contribution to our financial performance and condition, as well as the officer's
	qualifications, skills, experience and responsibilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	its February 2015 meeting, our Compensation Committee reviewed data provided by Longnecker with respect to our 2015 compensation peer group and approved increases to the base salaries
	of certain of our Named Executive Officers for fiscal year 2015. These increases were primarily implemented so that the base salaries of our Named Executive Officers would more closely align with the
	50th&nbsp;percentile of our 2015 compensation peer group. The 2015 base salaries of our Named Executive Officers were set as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_30"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Base
	salaries for each of the Named Executive Officers listed in the table above, prior to the modification by our Compensation Committee, were as follows:
	$300,000 for Mr.&nbsp;Haight, $225,000 for Ms.&nbsp;Walker. The base salaries enumerated in the table above were effective January&nbsp;1, 2015 for Mr.&nbsp;Haight, Mr.&nbsp;Eck, and
	Ms.&nbsp;Walker, except with respect to Mr.&nbsp;Brace, who was hired in March, 2015. Mr.&nbsp;Elkins, whose base salary was also effective on January&nbsp;1, 2015 to correspond with his
	promotion, received an additional increase effective September&nbsp;1, 2015 to $400,000.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additionally,
	in connection with Mr.&nbsp;Brace's appointment as Interim President and Chief Executive Officer on March&nbsp;18, 2015, the Compensation Committee reviewed data
	provided by Longnecker with respect to the compensation of interim chief executive officers of similarly situated companies and approved cash compensation of $100,000 per month to Mr.&nbsp;Brace for
	assuming the role. During 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Brace participated in the Company's annual performance-based cash incentive bonus program but did not receive any equity grants under the LTIP related to his
	service as Interim President and Chief Executive Officer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Annual Performance-Based Cash Incentive Awards
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have historically utilized, and expect to continue to utilize, performance-based
	annual cash
	incentive awards to reward achievement of specified performance goals for the Company as a whole with a time horizon of one year or less. We include an annual performance-based cash incentive award as
	part of our compensation program because we believe this element of compensation helps to:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	motivate management to achieve key annual corporate objectives, and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	align executives' interests with our goals.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amounts
	paid under the performance-based annual cash incentive program are paid in the Compensation Committee's sole discretion. The Compensation Committee takes into account several
	quantitative and qualitative factors, including the achievement of pre-established goals or metrics, which we call "Key Performance Indicators," or "KPIs," when determining the amount of payment
	awarded to each Named Executive Officer. At the beginning of each year, our Chief Executive Officer develops a proposal for the annual performance metrics for that year. The Chief Executive Officer
	then presents his proposal to the Compensation Committee, which independently analyzes the proposed annual
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	101
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=101,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=494159,FOLIO='101',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DU77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:58' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DU77201_1_102">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	performance
	metrics, makes modifications as it sees fit, and then approves a final set of performance metrics for the year. The performance metrics are then presented to the Named Executive Officers
	and other members of senior management so that they fully understand the program and the goals for that particular year. In the event that the Company makes a material acquisition during the course of
	the year, the performance metrics may be adjusted by the Compensation Committee, in its discretion, to appropriately address any changes in the asset makeup of the Company post-acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	our annual bonus program, our performance goals serve less as a formula and more as guidelines for our Compensation Committee to utilize throughout the year to ensure that payment
	of compensation under the program is aligned with the achievement of our Company's goals and targets. The performance goals are only one factor utilized by our Compensation Committee when determining
	actual amounts of awards. Our Compensation Committee considers a number of other subjective factors and retains the ability to apply discretion to awards based on factors such as extenuating market
	circumstances or individual performance and to modify amounts based on safety performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	we achieve the target performance metric, the cash incentive awards are expected to be paid at target levels. In order to create additional incentive for exceptional company
	performance based on the metrics described above and the discretion of our Compensation Committee, awards can be paid up to a maximum percentage of the base salary designated for each Named Executive
	Officer, but it is not expected that payment at this level would occur in most years. We set threshold, target and maximum levels for the performance metrics to serve as a guideline for determining
	the actual bonus amounts earned by our Named Executive Officers for 2015. In setting the performance incentive metrics for 2015, our Compensation Committee considered the extent to which targets were
	met in prior years to ensure that the targets utilized were sufficiently challenging. In February 2015, the Compensation Committee established the target, threshold and maximum awards to our Named
	Executive Officers, as a percentage of base salary, as set out in the table below. Actual award amounts are dependent on performance relative to specified performance metrics and subject to the
	discretion of our Compensation Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_31"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2015, the Compensation Committee established six KPIs, in addition to an overall adjustment for safety and environmental performance that could increase bonuses awarded under the
	Bonus Plan by up to 25% in the event of extraordinary performance in that area or decrease the bonuses awarded under the Bonus Plan by up to 100% in the event of severe underperformance. The specific
	goals set by the Compensation Committee at the beginning of 2015 and the weight given to each are listed below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	102
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

	Overall consideration of performance in these areas, which may increase or decrease total bonus amount

</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Actual
	performance for each KPI for the fiscal year is measured and reviewed by the Compensation Committee during the first few months following the end of the fiscal year for which the
	annual bonus is earned. As noted above, while the Compensation Committee closely examines company and individual performance with respect to each KPI, the Compensation Committee retains the discretion
	to increase or decrease a Named Executive Officer's annual cash bonus despite KPI performance based on an overall qualitative assessment of the individual officer's performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	February 2016, the Compensation Committee reviewed 2015 actual performance against each of the KPIs. The Company achieved (i)&nbsp;between the target and maximum performance for
	payout under the Production Volumes metric, (ii)&nbsp;between the target and maximum under the Development Program Internal Rate of Return metric, (iii)&nbsp;above maximum performance under the
	Reserve Replacement Cost metric, (iv)&nbsp;between the target and maximum performance under the Lease Operating Expense metric, (v), above maximum performance under the G&amp;A Expense metric, and
	(vi)&nbsp;above maximum performance under the Fund Liquidity Gap metric, which was established to focus primarily upon maintaining financial flexibility and improvement of debt metrics. The
	Compensation Committee did not increase or decrease the payout under the 2015 Bonus Plan for safety and environmental performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Overall,
	the formulaic outcome based on the above KPI payouts called for a total payout under the 2015 Bonus Plan of approximately 100% of the target level. The Compensation Committee
	granted the Named Executive Officers awards in the following amounts, which are included in the "Non-Equity Incentive Plan Compensation" column of the "Summary Compensation Table" for 2015:
	Mr.&nbsp;Brace&#151;$1,362,598; Mr.&nbsp;Haight&#151;$420,126; Mr.&nbsp;Eck&#151;$407,360; and Mr.&nbsp;Elkins&#151;$338,618. Our employment relationship with
	Dr.&nbsp;Hill, Mr.&nbsp;Eck and Ms.&nbsp;Walker terminated prior to the payment of the 2015 annual bonus. Dr.&nbsp;Hill did not receive payment of his 2015 annual bonus. Pursuant to the terms
	of their individual separation agreements with the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Eck and Ms.&nbsp;Walker received their respective annual bonus payments for 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Long-Term Equity-Based Incentives
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe a formal long-term equity incentive program is a valuable compensation tool and is
	consistent with the
	compensation programs of the companies in our peer group. We maintain a Long-Term Incentive Plan, or LTIP, which permits the grant of our stock, options, restricted stock, restricted stock units,
	phantom stock, stock appreciation rights and other awards, any of which may be designated as performance awards or be made subject to other conditions. We believe
	that long-term equity-based incentive compensation is an important component of our overall compensation program because it:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	balances short and long-term objectives;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	rewards long-term performance relative to industry peers;
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	103
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=103,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=910567,FOLIO='103',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DU77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:58' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DU77201_1_104">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	makes our compensation program competitive from a total remuneration standpoint;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	encourages executive retention.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	Compensation Committee has the authority under the LTIP to award incentive equity compensation to our executive officers in such amounts and on such terms as the Committee determines
	appropriate in its sole discretion. To date, our long-term equity-based incentive compensation program has consisted solely of restricted stock awards. The Compensation Committee may determine in the
	future that different and/or additional award types are appropriate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	2015, our Compensation Committee made annual awards of restricted stock to our Named Executive Officers with an aggregate value at the time of grant equal to a specified percentage
	of the individual's base salary for the year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Loyalty and Retention Awards.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On December&nbsp;18, 2014, the Compensation Committee approved the award of cash and equity retention
	awards to
	Mr.&nbsp;Haight and Ms.&nbsp;Walker. The cash retention award granted to Mr.&nbsp;Haight was in the amount of $750,000, and the cash retention award granted to Ms.&nbsp;Walker was in the
	amount of $405,000. The awards were paid out in three equal installments on each of January&nbsp;1, 2015, June&nbsp;1, 2015, and December&nbsp;1, 2015, and required that the executive remained
	continuously employed (and not provide notice of intent to terminate employment) through each such date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	June&nbsp;6, 2014, the Compensation Committee approved the award of cash and equity retention awards to Mr.&nbsp;Haight, Mr.&nbsp;Elkins and Ms.&nbsp;Walker. The cash
	retention award granted for Mr.&nbsp;Haight was in the amount of $90,000 and was designed to pay out in three equal installments on each of July&nbsp;1, 2014, January&nbsp;2, 2015 and
	July&nbsp;1, 2015, provided that the executive remained continuously employed (and not provide notice of intent to terminate employment) through each such date. The cash retention award granted for
	Mr.&nbsp;Elkins was in the amount of $130,000 and was designed to pay out in three installments as follows, $30,000 on July&nbsp;1, 2014, $50,000 on January&nbsp;2, 2015 and $50,000 on
	July&nbsp;1, 2015, provided that the executive remains continuously employed (and not provide notice of intent to terminate employment) through each such date. The cash retention award granted for
	Ms.&nbsp;Walker was in the amount of $67,500 and was designed to pay out in three equal installments on each of July&nbsp;1, 2014, January&nbsp;2, 2015 and on July&nbsp;1, 2015, provided that
	the executive remained continuously employed (and not provide notice of intent to terminate employment) through each such date. Additionally, at the February 2015 Compensation Committee Meeting,
	Mr.&nbsp;Elkins was awarded an additional retention award in the amount of $325,000 which was designed to pay out in three equal installments on each of June&nbsp;1, 2015, January&nbsp;1, 2016
	and June&nbsp;1, 2016. The executives may be eligible to receive payment of the cash loyalty and equity retention awards in connection with a termination of employment by us without cause or by the
	executive for good reason.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other Employee Benefits
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All of our full-time employees, including our Named Executive Officers, receive the same health and welfare
	benefits. The
	benefits include a 401(k) retirement program with a company match of up to 8% of base salary, health insurance, dental insurance, life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance, as well as long
	term disability insurance. We do not currently offer any other retirement or pension program as we feel that the compensation package offered to our Named Executive Officers provides compensation and
	incentives sufficient to attract and retain excellent talent without the addition of this benefit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	104
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=104,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=776121,FOLIO='104',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DU77201A.;14',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:58' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DW77201_1_105">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employment Agreements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Named Executive Officer Employment Agreements
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have entered into employment agreements with certain of our executive officers ("Employment Agreements"). The initial term of the
	Employment Agreements is two years with automatic extensions for additional one-year periods unless either party provides at least sixty days advance written notice of the intent to terminate the
	Employment Agreement. Each
	executive is entitled to four weeks of vacation each year during the term of the Employment Agreement. The Employment Agreement contains a confidentiality obligation on the part of the executive of
	indefinite duration and non-competition and non-solicitation obligations on the part of the executive for a period of one-year following his termination of employment with us for any reason other than
	death or disability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
	a termination of the executive's employment by us for Cause, by the executive without Good Reason, or due to death or disability during the term of the Employment Agreement, the
	executive is entitled to: (i)&nbsp;the portion of the executive's base salary accrued through the termination to the extent not previously paid, any expense reimbursement accrued and unpaid, any
	employee benefits pursuant to the terms of the applicable employee benefit plan, and any accrued but unused vacation (the "Accrued Obligations"), and (ii)&nbsp;any accrued or vested amount arising
	from the executive's participation in, or benefits under, any incentive plans (the "Accrued Incentives"), which amounts are payable in accordance with the terms and conditions of such incentive plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
	a termination of the executive's employment by us without Cause or by the executive for Good Reason during the term of the Employment Agreement, the executive is entitled to:
	(i)&nbsp;the Accrued Obligations, (ii)&nbsp;the Accrued Incentives, (iii)&nbsp;a lump-sum cash payment equal to the average annual bonus paid to the executive for the three immediately preceding
	completed fiscal years, and (iv)&nbsp;continued payment of the executive's base salary for a period of time.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
	a termination of the executive's employment by us without Cause or by the executive for Good Reason during the term of the Employment Agreement and within twelve months of a change
	in control of us, the executive is entitled to: (i)&nbsp;the Accrued Obligations, (ii)&nbsp;the Accrued Incentives, (iii)&nbsp;accelerated vesting for all equity or equity based awards granted
	under the long-term incentive plan that are not intended to be "qualified performance based compensation" within the meaning of Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code (the "Code"), and
	(iv)&nbsp;a lump-sum cash payment equal to the product of (x)&nbsp;the highest annual bonus paid to the executive for the three immediately preceding completed fiscal years plus the highest base
	salary paid to the executive during the three years immediately preceding the change in control, multiplied by (y)&nbsp;2.0.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	purposes of the Employment Agreement, "Cause", in all material respects, means: (i)&nbsp;nonperformance by the executive of his obligations and duties, (ii)&nbsp;commission by
	the executive of an act of fraud, embezzlement, misappropriation, willful misconduct or breach of fiduciary duty against us or other conduct harmful or potentially harmful to our best interest,
	(iii)&nbsp;a material breach by the executive of the non-competition, non-solicitation, or confidentiality obligations under the Employment Agreement, (iv)&nbsp;the executive's conviction, plea of
	no contest or nolo contendere, deferred adjudication or unadjudicated probation for any felony or any crime involving fraud, dishonesty, or moral turpitude or causing material harm, financial or
	otherwise, to us, (v)&nbsp;the refusal or failure of the executive to carry out, or comply with, in any material respect, any lawful directive of our Board of Directors, (vi)&nbsp;the executive's
	unlawful use (including being under the influence) or possession of illegal drugs, or (vii)&nbsp;the executive's willful violation of any federal, state, or local law or regulation applicable to us
	or our business which adversely affects us.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	purposes of the Employment Agreement, "Good Reason" means any of the following, but only if occurring without the executive's consent: (i)&nbsp;a material diminution in the
	executive's base salary, (ii)&nbsp;a material diminution in the executive's authority, duties, or responsibilities, (iii)&nbsp;the relocation of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	105
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=105,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=1040398,FOLIO='105',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DW77201A.;8',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:58' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DW77201_1_106">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the
	executive's principal office to an area more than 50 miles from its location immediately prior to such relocation, or (iv)&nbsp;our failure to comply with any material provision of the
	Employment Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severance
	payments made under the Employment Agreement are contingent upon the executive's execution of a valid release of claims. Further, severance payments may be stopped and any
	payments already made must be repaid in the event the executive violates the confidentiality, non-competition or non-solicitation provisions of the Employment Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;280G
	of the Code prevents a corporate payor from deducting certain large payments contingent upon a change in control ("parachute payments") from the corporation's gross
	income for federal tax purposes. In addition, Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code imposes an excise tax on the recipient of an excess parachute payment equal to 20% of the amount of the excess parachute
	payment. In the event that Section&nbsp;280G of the Code applies to any compensation payable to the executives, the Employment Agreement provides that we will either (x)&nbsp;reduce the payment(s)
	to an amount that is one dollar less than the amount that would trigger the application of Section&nbsp;280G of the Code, or (y)&nbsp;make the full payment owed to the executive, whichever of
	(x)&nbsp;or (y)&nbsp;results in the best net after tax position for the executive. The Employment Agreements do not provide any obligation for us to pay a "gross-up" or make the executive whole
	for any excise or regular income taxes, including the excise taxes that may be due under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employment Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Brace
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the appointment of Mr.&nbsp;Brace as interim President and Chief Executive Officer, we entered into an employment
	agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Brace outlining the terms of his employment (the "Brace Employment Agreement"). The material terms of the Brace Employment Agreement are outlined below. Except as noted
	otherwise below, capitalized terms used but not defined shall have the same meanings as described above with respect to the Employment Agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
	to the Brace Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Brace began serving as our interim President and Chief Executive Officer for an initial term commencing on March&nbsp;9, 2015 and
	ending on September&nbsp;9, 2016, with automatic six-month term extensions following the expiration of the initial term or any subsequent six-month extension term, provided that neither party
	provides a notice of non-renewal at least 60&nbsp;days prior to September&nbsp;9, 2016 or the end of the applicable extension term. Under the Brace Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Brace receives
	a monthly base salary of $100,000, which may be increased, but not decreased, at any time at the discretion of the Board of Directors. Mr.&nbsp;Brace is also eligible to receive an annual cash bonus
	and to participate in all other bonus, incentive, retirement and similar plans applicable generally to other similarly situated employees of us. Mr.&nbsp;Brace's target annual cash bonus is equal to
	100&nbsp;percent of his annual base salary, with the maximum annual cash bonus equal to 200&nbsp;percent of his annual base salary and the minimum guaranteed annual cash bonus equal to
	50&nbsp;percent of his annual base salary. Under the terms of the Brace Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Brace and/or his family, as the case may be, is also eligible to participate in other welfare
	benefit plans, in accordance with the terms and conditions of applicable policies as may be in effect and/or amended from time to time. Additionally, under the Brace Employment Agreement,
	Mr.&nbsp;Brace is eligible to receive other fringe benefits and limited perquisites appertaining to his position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
	a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Brace's employment by us for Cause (as defined below), by Mr.&nbsp;Brace without Good Reason (as defined below), or due to death or disability during
	the term of the Brace Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Brace (or, in the case of death, Mr.&nbsp;Brace's legal representative) will be eligible to receive the Accrued Obligations and the Accrued
	Incentives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
	a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Brace's employment by us without Cause or by Mr.&nbsp;Brace for Good Reason, in either case, during the term of the Brace Employment Agreement,
	Mr.&nbsp;Brace would receive
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	106
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	the
	following: (i)&nbsp;the Accrued Obligations, (ii)&nbsp;the Accrued Incentives, (iii)&nbsp;a lump-sum cash payment equal to the greater of (x)&nbsp;the average of the annual cash bonuses
	paid to Mr.&nbsp;Brace for the period employed with us or (y)&nbsp;the target annual cash bonus (i.e.,&nbsp;100&nbsp;percent of Mr.&nbsp;Brace's annual base salary), and (iv)&nbsp;the
	continued payment of Mr.&nbsp;Brace's base salary for the remainder of the term of the Brace Employment Agreement.

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	purposes of the Brace Employment Agreement, "Cause", in all material respects, means: (i)&nbsp;nonperformance by Mr.&nbsp;Brace of his obligations and duties that is not cured
	after written notice from the Board of Directors, (ii)&nbsp;commission by Mr.&nbsp;Brace of an act of fraud, embezzlement, misappropriation, willful misconduct or breach of fiduciary duty against
	us or other conduct harmful or potentially harmful to our best interest, (iii)&nbsp;a material breach by Mr.&nbsp;Brace of the non-competition, non-solicitation, or confidentiality obligations
	under the Brace Employment Agreement that is not cured after written notice from the Board of Directors, (iv)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Brace's conviction, plea of no contest or nolo contendere, deferred
	adjudication or unadjudicated probation for any felony or any crime
	involving fraud, dishonesty, or moral turpitude or causing material harm, financial or otherwise, to us, (v)&nbsp;the refusal or failure of Mr.&nbsp;Brace to carry out, or comply with, in any
	material respect, any lawful directive of our Board of Directors that is not cured after written notice from the Board of Directors, (vi)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Brace's unlawful use (including being under
	the influence) or possession of illegal drugs, or (vii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Brace's willful violation of any federal, state, or local law or regulation applicable to us or our business which adversely
	affects us that is not cured after written notice from the Board of Directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	purposes of the Brace Employment Agreement, "Good Reason" means any of the following, but only if occurring without Mr.&nbsp;Brace's consent: (i)&nbsp;a material diminution in
	Mr.&nbsp;Brace's base salary or target annual cash bonus opportunity, (ii)&nbsp;a material diminution in Mr.&nbsp;Brace's authority, duties, or responsibilities, (iii)&nbsp;the relocation of
	Mr.&nbsp;Brace's principal office to an area more than 50 miles from its location immediately prior to such relocation, or (iv)&nbsp;our failure to comply with any material provision of the Brace
	Employment Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severance
	payments made under the Brace Employment Agreement are contingent upon Mr.&nbsp;Brace's execution of a valid release of claims. Further, severance payments may be stopped and
	any payments already made must be repaid in the event Mr.&nbsp;Brace violates the confidentiality, non-competition or non-solicitation provisions of the Brace Employment Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event that Section&nbsp;280G of the Code applies to any compensation payable to Mr.&nbsp;Brace, the Brace Employment Agreement provides that we will either (x)&nbsp;reduce
	the payment(s) to an amount that is one dollar less than the amount that would trigger the application of Section&nbsp;280G of the Code, or (y)&nbsp;make the full payment owed to Mr.&nbsp;Brace,
	whichever of (x)&nbsp;or (y)&nbsp;results in the best net after tax position for Mr.&nbsp;Brace. The Brace Employment Agreement does not provide any obligation for us to pay a "gross-up" or make
	Mr.&nbsp;Brace whole for any excise or regular income taxes, including the excise taxes that may be due under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employment Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Haight
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the appointment of Mr.&nbsp;Haight as Executive Vice-President and Chief Financial Officer, we amended his
	employment agreement with the Company (the "Amended Haight Employment Agreement"). The material terms of the Amended Haight Employment Agreement are outlined below. Except as noted otherwise below,
	capitalized terms used but not defined shall have the same meanings as described above with respect to the Employment Agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
	to the Amended Haight Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Haight will serve as our Executive Vice-President, Chief Financial Officer and Chief Accounting Officer for an initial
	term commencing on January&nbsp;6, 2014 and ending on April&nbsp;24, 2014, with automatic one-year term extensions following the
	expiration of the initial term or any subsequent one-year extension term, provided that neither party provides a notice of non-renewal at least 60&nbsp;days prior to April&nbsp;25, 2014 or the end
	of the
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	107

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=107,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=250715,FOLIO='107',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DW77201A.;8',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:58' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DW77201_1_108">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	applicable
	one-year extension term. Under the Amended Haight Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Haight will receive a minimum annual base salary of $300,000 (current annual base salary of $375,000),
	which may be increased, but not decreased, at any time at the discretion of the Board of Directors. Mr.&nbsp;Haight is also eligible to receive an annual cash bonus and to participate in all other
	bonus, incentive, retirement and similar plans applicable generally to other similarly situated employees of us. Mr.&nbsp;Haight's target annual cash bonus is set at the discretion of the Board. His
	current target is equal to 80&nbsp;percent of his annual base salary, with the maximum annual cash bonus equal to 160&nbsp;percent of his annual base salary and the minimum annual cash bonus equal
	to 40&nbsp;percent of his annual base salary. Under the terms of the Amended Haight Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Haight and/or his family, as the case may be, is also eligible to participate in
	other welfare benefit plans, in accordance with the terms and conditions of applicable policies as may be in effect and/or amended from time to time. Additionally, under the Amended Haight Employment
	Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Haight is eligible to receive other fringe benefits and limited perquisites appertaining to his position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
	a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Haight's employment by us for Cause (as defined below), by Mr.&nbsp;Haight without Good Reason (as defined below), or due to death or disability during
	the term of the Amended Haight Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Haight (or, in the case of death, Mr.&nbsp;Haight's legal representative) will be eligible to receive the Accrued Obligations and the
	Accrued Incentives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
	a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Haight's employment by us without Cause or by Mr.&nbsp;Haight for Good Reason, in either case, during the term of the Amended Haight Employment
	Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Haight would receive the following: (i)&nbsp;the Accrued Obligations, (ii)&nbsp;the Accrued Incentives, (iii)&nbsp;a lump-sum cash payment equal to the average of the
	annual cash bonuses paid to Mr.&nbsp;Haight for the last three years, or if Mr.&nbsp;Haight has not been employed at the date of termination for three years, the period employed with us and
	(iv)&nbsp;the continued payment of Mr.&nbsp;Haight's base salary for a period of 18&nbsp;months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	purposes of the Amended Haight Employment Agreement, "Cause", in all material respects, means: (i)&nbsp;nonperformance by Mr.&nbsp;Haight of his obligations and duties that is
	not cured after written notice from the Board of Directors, (ii)&nbsp;commission by Mr.&nbsp;Haight of an act of fraud, embezzlement, misappropriation, willful misconduct or breach of fiduciary
	duty against us or other conduct harmful or potentially harmful to our best interest, (iii)&nbsp;a material breach by Mr.&nbsp;Haight of the non-competition, non-solicitation, or confidentiality
	obligations under the Amended Haight Employment Agreement that is not cured after written notice from the Board of Directors, (iv)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Haight's conviction, plea of no contest or nolo
	contendere, deferred adjudication or unadjudicated probation for any felony or any crime involving fraud, dishonesty, or moral turpitude or causing material harm, financial or otherwise, to us,
	(v)&nbsp;the refusal or failure of Mr.&nbsp;Haight to carry out, or comply with, in any material respect, any lawful directive of our Board of Directors that is not cured after written notice from
	the Board of
	Directors, (vi)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Haight's unlawful use (including being under the influence) or possession of illegal drugs, or (vii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Haight's willful violation of any federal,
	state, or local law or regulation applicable to us or our business which adversely affects us that is not cured after written notice from the Board of Directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	purposes of the Amended Haight Employment Agreement, "Good Reason" means any of the following, but only if occurring without Mr.&nbsp;Haight's consent: (i)&nbsp;a material
	diminution in Mr.&nbsp;Haight's base salary or target annual cash bonus opportunity, (ii)&nbsp;a material diminution in Mr.&nbsp;Haight's authority, duties, or responsibilities, (iii)&nbsp;the
	relocation of Mr.&nbsp;Haight's principal office to an area more than 50 miles from its location immediately prior to such relocation, or (iv)&nbsp;our failure to comply with any material
	provision of the Amended Haight Employment Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severance
	payments made under the Amended Haight Employment Agreement are contingent upon Mr.&nbsp;Haight's execution of a valid release of claims. Further, severance payments may be
	stopped
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	108
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and
	any payments already made must be repaid in the event Mr.&nbsp;Haight violates the confidentiality, non-competition or non-solicitation provisions of the Amended Haight Employment Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event that Section&nbsp;280G of the Code applies to any compensation payable to Mr.&nbsp;Haight, the Amended Haight Employment Agreement provides that we will either
	(x)&nbsp;reduce the payment(s) to an amount that is one dollar less than the amount that would trigger the application of Section&nbsp;280G of the Code, or (y)&nbsp;make the full payment owed to
	Mr.&nbsp;Haight, whichever of (x)&nbsp;or (y)&nbsp;results in the best net after tax position for Mr.&nbsp;Haight. The Amended Haight Employment Agreement does not provide any obligation for
	us to pay a "gross-up" or make Mr.&nbsp;Haight whole for any excise or regular income taxes, including the excise taxes that may be due under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employment Agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Elkins
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In connection with the appointment of Mr.&nbsp;Elkins as Executive Vice-President of Operations, we entered into an employment
	agreement with Mr.&nbsp;Elkins outlining the terms of his employment (the "Elkins Employment Agreement"). The material terms of the Elkins Employment Agreement are outlined below. Except as noted
	otherwise below, capitalized terms used
	but not defined shall have the same meanings as described above with respect to the Employment Agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant
	to the Elkins Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Elkins will serve as our Executive Vice-President of Operations for an initial term commencing on April&nbsp;1, 2014 and ending
	on the second anniversary of such date, with automatic one-year term extensions following the expiration of the initial term or any subsequent one-year extension term, provided that neither party
	provides a notice of non-renewal at least 60&nbsp;days prior to April&nbsp;1, 2016 or the end of the applicable one-year extension term. Under the Elkins Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Elkins
	will receive a minimum annual base salary of $300,000 (current annual base salary of $325,000), which may be increased, but not decreased, at any time at the discretion of the Board of Directors.
	Mr.&nbsp;Elkins is also eligible to receive an annual cash bonus and to participate in all other bonus, incentive, retirement and similar plans applicable generally to other similarly situated
	employees of us. Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' target annual cash bonus is set at the discretion of the Board. His current target is equal to 80&nbsp;percent of his annual base salary, with the maximum annual
	cash bonus equal to 160&nbsp;percent of his annual base salary and the minimum annual cash bonus equal to 40&nbsp;percent of his annual base salary. Under the terms of the Elkins Employment
	Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Elkins and/or his family, as the case may be, is also eligible to participate in other welfare benefit plans, in accordance with the terms and conditions of applicable policies
	as may be in effect and/or amended from time to time. Additionally, under the Elkins Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Elkins is eligible to receive other fringe benefits and limited perquisites
	appertaining to his position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
	a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' employment by us for Cause (as defined below), by Mr.&nbsp;Elkins without Good Reason (as defined below), or due to death or disability during
	the term of the Elkins Employment Agreement, Mr.&nbsp;Elkins (or, in the case of death, Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' legal representative) will be eligible to receive the Accrued Obligations and the Accrued
	Incentives.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
	a termination of Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' employment by us without Cause or by Mr.&nbsp;Elkins for Good Reason, in either case, during the term of the Elkins Employment Agreement,
	Mr.&nbsp;Elkins would receive the following: (i)&nbsp;the Accrued Obligations, (ii)&nbsp;the Accrued Incentives, (iii)&nbsp;a lump-sum cash payment equal to the average of the annual cash
	bonuses paid to Mr.&nbsp;Elkins for the last three years, or if Mr.&nbsp;Elkins has not been employed at the date of termination for three years, the period employed with us and (iv)&nbsp;the
	continued payment of Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' base salary for a period of 12&nbsp;months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	purposes of the Elkins Employment Agreement, "Cause", in all material respects, means: (i)&nbsp;nonperformance by Mr.&nbsp;Elkins of his obligations and duties that is not cured
	after written notice from the Board of Directors, (ii)&nbsp;commission by Mr.&nbsp;Elkins of an act of fraud, embezzlement, misappropriation, willful misconduct or breach of fiduciary duty against
	us or other conduct harmful or
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	109
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	potentially
	harmful to our best interest, (iii)&nbsp;a material breach by Mr.&nbsp;Elkins of the non-competition, non-solicitation, or confidentiality obligations under the Elkins Employment
	Agreement that is not cured after written notice from the Board of Directors, (iv)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' conviction, plea of no contest or nolo contendere, deferred adjudication or unadjudicated
	probation for any felony or any crime involving fraud, dishonesty, or moral turpitude or causing material harm, financial or otherwise, to us, (v)&nbsp;the refusal or failure of Mr.&nbsp;Elkins to
	carry out, or comply with, in any material respect, any lawful directive of our Board of Directors that is not cured after written notice from the Board of Directors, (vi)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Elkins'
	unlawful use (including being under the influence) or possession of illegal drugs, or (vii)&nbsp;Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' willful violation of any federal, state, or local law or regulation applicable to
	us or our business which adversely affects us that is not cured after written notice from the Board of Directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	purposes of the Elkins Employment Agreement, "Good Reason" means any of the following, but only if occurring without Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' consent: (i)&nbsp;a material diminution in
	Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' base salary or target annual cash bonus opportunity, (ii)&nbsp;a material diminution in Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' authority, duties, or responsibilities, (iii)&nbsp;the relocation of
	Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' principal office to an area more than 50 miles from its location immediately prior to such relocation, or (iv)&nbsp;our failure to comply with any material provision of the Elkins
	Employment Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Severance
	payments made under the Elkins Employment Agreement are contingent upon Mr.&nbsp;Elkins' execution of a valid release of claims. Further, severance payments may be stopped
	and any payments already made must be repaid in the event Mr.&nbsp;Elkins violates the confidentiality, non-competition or non-solicitation provisions of the Elkins Employment Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event that Section&nbsp;280G of the Code applies to any compensation payable to Mr.&nbsp;Elkins, the Elkins Employment Agreement provides that we will either (x)&nbsp;reduce
	the payment(s) to an amount that is one dollar less than the amount that would trigger the application of Section&nbsp;280G of the Code, or (y)&nbsp;make the full payment owed to
	Mr.&nbsp;Elkins, whichever of (x)&nbsp;or (y)&nbsp;results in the best net after tax position for Mr.&nbsp;Elkins. The Elkins Employment Agreement does not provide any obligation for us to pay
	a "gross-up" or make Mr.&nbsp;Elkins whole for any excise or regular income taxes, including the excise taxes that may be due under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Severance Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Mark E. Eck
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective January&nbsp;4, 2016, Mr.&nbsp;Eck resigned from employment with the Company. In connection with his resignation,
	Mr.&nbsp;Eck entered into an agreement with the Company pursuant to which Mr.&nbsp;Eck received a lump sum payment equivalent to his accrued 2015 short term incentive bonus, which was paid in
	February 2016. Pursuant to the terms of Company's 2012 Long-Term Incentive Plan, any unvested shares of restricted stock which were previously awarded to Mr.&nbsp;Eck expired on January&nbsp;4,
	2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Kelly L. Walker
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective January&nbsp;4, 2016, Ms.&nbsp;Walker resigned from employment with the Company. In connection with her resignation,
	Ms.&nbsp;Walker entered into an agreement with the Company pursuant to which Ms.&nbsp;Walker will receive a lump sum payment equivalent to the following: her annual base salary in the amount of
	$270,000; the average of her past three annual bonus payments, which was $134,313; and her accrued 2015 short term incentive bonus, in the amount of $204,719. Additionally, the vesting of all unvested
	shares of restricted stock held by Ms.&nbsp;Walker as of her separation date was accelerated, with any settlement that may be due to Ms.&nbsp;Walker as a result of such accelerated vesting being
	made pursuant to the terms of the Company's 2012 Long-Term Incentive Plan.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=110,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=524375,FOLIO='110',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DW77201A.;8',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:58' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DW77201_1_111">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Accounting and Tax Considerations
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code a limitation is placed on tax deductions of any publicly-held corporation for
	individual compensation to "covered employees" (within the meaning of Section&nbsp;162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code) of such corporation exceeding $1,000,000 in any taxable year, unless the
	compensation meets certain requirements for qualified "performance-based compensation." Newly public companies generally are not subject to the deduction limitations of Section&nbsp;162(m) of the
	Internal Revenue Code until the first stockholder meeting that
	occurs after the close of the third calendar year following the calendar year in which the initial public offering occurs, or at the time of a material amendment to the plan, whichever occurs first.
	We became subject to the limitations and requirements of Section&nbsp;162(m) as of the 2014 Annual Meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
	the extent possible, we seek to maintain the favorable tax treatment of compensation. We believe, however, that under some circumstances, such as to attract or retain key executives
	or to recognize outstanding performance, it is in the best interest of the Company to provide compensation to selected executives even if it is not fully deductible.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;280G
	of the Code prevents a corporate payor of certain types of payments made to executives in connection with a change of control from deducting portions of such payments
	from the corporation's gross income for federal income tax purposes, to the extent they exceed certain monetary thresholds (the excess over those thresholds is referred to as the "excess parachute
	payment"). In addition, Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code imposes an excise tax on the recipient of these payments equal to 20% of the amount of the excess parachute payment. Some companies provide
	"gross-ups" to their executives to cover any excise tax that may become due under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code. The Employment Agreements do not provide any obligation for us to pay a "gross-up" or
	make the executive whole for any excise or regular income taxes, including any excise taxes that may be due under Section&nbsp;4999 of the Code.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
	equity awards to our employees, including our Named Executive Officers, and to our directors will be granted and reflected in our consolidated financial statements, based upon the
	applicable accounting guidance, at fair market value on the grant date in accordance with Financial Accounting Standards Board ("FASB") Accounting Standards Codification ("ASC"), Topic 718,
	"Compensation&#151;Stock Compensation."
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Compensation Practices as They Relate to Risk Management
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe our compensation programs do not encourage excessive and unnecessary risk taking by executive officers (or other employees).
	Our annual performance-based cash incentive program is based upon several different performance metrics that are both quantitative and qualitative. Further, because our Compensation Committee retains
	the ability to apply discretion when determining the actual amount to be paid to executives pursuant to our annual performance-based cash incentive program, our Compensation Committee is able to
	assess the actual behavior of our executives as it relates to risk taking in awarding bonus amounts. Further, our use of long-term equity-based compensation reduces any potential incentives to take
	unnecessary short-term risk.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	111
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_DY77201_COMPENSATION_COMMITTEE_REPORT">
</A>
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DY77201_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REPORT
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Compensation Committee of the Company has reviewed and discussed the Compensation Discussion and Analysis required by
	Item&nbsp;402(b) of Regulation&nbsp;S-K with management and, based on such review and discussions, the Compensation Committee recommended to the Board of Directors that the Compensation Discussion
	and Analysis be included in this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	foregoing report is provided by the following directors, who constitute all the members of the Compensation Committee:
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<FONT SIZE=2>
	These
	amounts represent the payment of the cash loyalty and cash retention awards for Messrs.&nbsp;Haight and Elkins and Ms.&nbsp;Walker. The cash
	loyalty awards were designed to pay out in

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=112,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=502417,FOLIO='112',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DY77201A.;15',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:58' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DY77201_1_113">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	equal
	installments on each of June&nbsp;1, 2014, January&nbsp;2, 2015 and July&nbsp;1, 2015. The payment of the cash retention awards were designed to pay out on June&nbsp;1, 2015,
	January&nbsp;1, 2016 and June&nbsp;1, 2016 for Mr.&nbsp;Elkins and for Mr.&nbsp;Haight and Ms.&nbsp;Walker on January&nbsp;1, 2015, June&nbsp;1, 2015 and December&nbsp;1, 2015. For
	2015, Mr.&nbsp;Elkins received $50,000 for each cash loyalty award, and $108,333 for the two retention award payments. For 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Haight received $30,000 for each cash loyalty award, and
	$250,000 for the three cash retention award payments. Ms.&nbsp;Walker received $22,500 for each cash loyalty award, and $135,000 for the three cash retention award payments.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	amounts reflected in the table above for restricted stock are reported based upon the grant date fair value computed in accordance with Financial
	Accounting Standards Board ("FASB") Accounting Standard Codification ("ASC") Topic 718, excluding the effect of estimated forfeitures. See Note&nbsp;11 to our consolidated financial statements on
	Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 for additional detail regarding assumptions underlying the value of these equity awards.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	amounts reported in this column reflect the amount paid to each executive in February of 2016 with respect to performance in 2015 under our annual short
	term incentive bonus program. Our employment relationship with Dr.&nbsp;Hill terminated prior to the payment of his 2015 annual bonus.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(5)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	amounts presented for Messrs.&nbsp;Haight and Elkins and Ms.&nbsp;Walker represent a company match of 401(k) contributions made in 2015. The amount
	presented in this column for Dr.&nbsp;Hill for 2015 represents his vacation payout received following his termination of employment on April&nbsp;30, 2015.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(6)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Dr.&nbsp;Hill
	resigned from his position as our Interim President and Chief Executive Officer in March of 2015 but continued to provide transition
	services to us through April&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

	(1)

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	These
	columns reflect the threshold, target, and maximum levels established for each Named Executive Officer under our annual cash bonus program, calculated
	based on each Named Executive Officer's base salary in effect as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and utilizing the final threshold, target and maximum levels established by the Compensation Committee in
	2015. For more information about our annual cash bonus program or the Named Executive Officer's targets levels under that program, please see the "Compensation Discussion and
	Analysis&#151;Elements of our

<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DY77201_1_114">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Compensation
	and Why we Pay Each Element&#151;Annual Performance-Based Cash Incentive Awards" section of this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	amounts in this column represent the restricted stock granted to the Named Executive Officers on the respectively noted dates. These shares of
	restricted stock vest in three equal annual installments beginning one year from the date of grant. All the unvested restricted stock held by Mr.&nbsp;Eck was forfeited at the time of his separation
	from the Company.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	amounts reflected in the table above for restricted stock are reported based upon the grant date fair value computed in accordance FASB ASC Topic 718,
	excluding the effect of estimated forfeitures. See Note&nbsp;11 to our consolidated financial statements on Form&nbsp;10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 for additional detail
	regarding assumptions underlying the value of these equity awards.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Dr.&nbsp;Hill
	resigned from his position as our Interim President and Chief Executive Officer in March of 2015 but continued to provide transition
	services to us through April&nbsp;30, 2015.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_34"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Outstanding Equity Awards at Fiscal Year End
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>

	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	number of incentive unit awards reflected in this column does not correlate to the Company's common shares because the incentive units are interests in
	one of our affiliates. Incentive units represent actual equity interests in us or one of our affiliates that have no value for tax purposes on the date of grant and are designed to gain value only
	after we or one of our affiliates has
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=114,EFW="2228030",CP="MIDSTATES PETROLEUM COMPANY, INC",DN="1",CHK=37608,FOLIO='114',FILE='DISK135:[15ZCW1.15ZCW77201]DY77201A.;15',USER='MBLOUNT',CD='29-MAR-2016;10:58' -->
<A NAME="A2228030Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DY77201_1_115">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2228030Z10-K_HTM_BG77201A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	realized
	a certain level of growth and return to those individuals who hold certain other classes of our equity. We believe these interests are most similar economically to stock appreciation rights.
	The definition of "option" in the regulations governing this disclosure includes stock options, stock appreciation rights, and "similar instruments." Because we believe that incentive units are most
	similar to stock appreciation rights we think they are properly classified as "options" under the definition in the regulations governing this disclosure. As such, the incentive units granted to our
	Named Executive Officers are disclosed in the table above under the columns required by the regulations governing this disclosure for options (as defined in those regulations). The economics of
	incentive units are borne entirely by our investor, First Reserve Management,&nbsp;L.P. ("First Reserve"); however, due to the accounting treatment of the incentive units, we will record a non-cash
	compensation charge in the period any payment is made with respect to the incentive units. No options to purchase our stock, in the traditional sense of the term, have been granted to our Named
	Executive Officers.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>

	reported in this column represent time-vested restricted stock awards granted on February&nbsp;21, 2013. The awards vest in one-third increments
	over a three-year period on the anniversary of the date of grant.

</FONT>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_35"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Option Exercises and Stock Vested
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The table below sets forth, for each Named Executive Officer, information about lapses of restrictions on restricted stock awards
	during the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Our Named Executive Officers have not been granted any stock option awards.
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
